- Pride and Prejudice (1913) by Jane Austen: A classic romance novel set in England during the Regency period. The story follows the lives of two families - the Bennetts and the Dashwoods - as they navigate love, marriage, class, and societal expectations.

- Island of the Blue Dolphins (1960) by Marlys McFarland: A children's novel set on a remote island off the coast of Mexico. The story follows the adventures of a young boy named Tom as he explores his new home on the island and meets other residents, including a wise old man who teaches Tom important life lessons.

- Lady in the Water (2006) by M. Night Shyamalan: A psychological thriller set in modern-day America. The story follows a large apartment building superintendent named Cleveland Heep as he tries to unravel the mysterious disappearance of a young woman named Emily from the pool maintained by Heep. As Heep delves deeper into Emily's case, he discovers that Emily was actually a character from a bedtime story who is trying to make the journey back to her home.
